Olympic Games.name: American Pastimes: A Sporting Quiz
Olympic Games.description: Test your knowledge of American sports and their connection to the Olympic Games. This quiz covers a range of popular games and iconic moments in American sporting history. From baseball to tennis, see how well you know the fundamentals!

questions.text: What sporting event is held annually on Memorial Day weekend?
questions.hint: This auto race is one of the oldest and most prestigious in the U.S.

questions.text: In what year did the United States last win an Olympic gold medal in men's ice hockey?
questions.hint: This victory, known as the 'Miracle on Ice,' occurred during the Cold War.

questions.text: In baseball, how many balls make a walk?
questions.hint: This number of pitches outside the strike zone grants the batter a free base.

questions.text: In what year did the United States last win an Olympic gold medal in men's ice hockey?
questions.hint: This victory, known as the 'Miracle on Ice,' occurred during the Cold War.

questions.text: In bowling, how many pins must you knock down to get a strike?
questions.hint: A strike requires clearing the entire set of pins in one roll.

questions.text: In American football, how many points is a touchdown worth?
questions.hint: This is the primary scoring play, worth more than a field goal but less than with an extra point.

questions.text: Whom did Billie Jean King defeat in the famous 'Battle of the Sexes' tennis match?
questions.hint: This former male champion was challenged by King in a 1973 publicity stunt.

questions.text: In what sport do athletes compete for the Walker Cup?
questions.hint: This sport involves international amateur competition on manicured courses.
